meanings.definition: Relating to the belly or underside of an animal.
meanings.sent1: The ventral side of the fish is lighter in color.
meanings.sent2: The snake's ventral scales help it move smoothly on the ground.
meanings.sent3: The ventral view of the puppy's belly made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The ventral position of the turtle's shell protected it from predators.
meanings.sent5: The ventral fins of the shark were large and powerful.

meanings.definition: Situated on or toward the lower, abdominal plane of the body.
meanings.sent1: The ventral region of the body is sensitive to touch.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined the patient's ventral area for any signs of tenderness.
meanings.sent3: The ventral side of the cake was decorated with colorful frosting.
meanings.sent4: The ventral location of the heart is crucial for proper blood circulation.
meanings.sent5: The ventral part of the tree trunk had intricate patterns.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the front or anterior part of an organism.
meanings.sent1: The ventral eyes of the crab help it detect movement in front.
meanings.sent2: The ventral fins of the fish aid in steering and balance.
meanings.sent3: The ventral position of the sun in the sky marked the beginning of the day.
meanings.sent4: The ventral side of the flower faced the morning sun for optimal growth.
meanings.sent5: The ventral part of the car was designed for aerodynamic efficiency.
